headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From Waste Management’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Waste Management’s fourth quarter was marked by a negative market reaction, as both revenue and non-GAAP profit per share fell short of Wall Street’s expectations. Management attributed the results to ongoing cost optimization, disciplined pricing, and operational improvements in its core collection and disposal business. CEO James Fish highlighted that lower labor and maintenance costs, driven by investments in fleet and technology, improved operating leverage even as residential volume decline
